divs: sighting detailsi was on the highway in north denver, turning northwest on hwy 36 (between denver and boulder) from northbound 1-25. i believe it was either may 13 or 27, 2007. the sun was behind me and the weather was sunny and mostly clear. as i made the turn, i immediately noticed about 12-15 objects glinting in the distance ahead. at first it appeared to be a squadron of jets. i kept looking and it struck me as odd that the formation was so many planes so close together. as i approached, the formation appeared to be stationary, just ���hanging��� in the sky. the objects were all pointed in the same direction (south) and i could begin to make out that they were sharply chevron or triangle shaped; they had no fuselage or tail. after two or three minutes (i was going about 60 mph), i drove under the formation, which was still static in the sky, now directly above. the formation as i passed under it was in roughly a shotgun or scattershot pattern, about one to two object's distance between each object. the objects glinted in the sun, and appeared to be mechanical\metallic and not organic. the individual objects at the closest were probably about 1-3 miles above the ground based on the angle from the horizon that i could first see them through my windshield, how fast i was driving, and how long it took for me to pass under them. at arm���s length, individually about the size of a thumbnail, the formation about the size of a palm or hand. at the time i saw the formation, i kept trying to put it in a frame of reference of something that i had seen before: a squadron of jets, or a flock of birds, but neither scenario matched what i was seeing. i briefly looked over at other drivers going in the same direction to see if anyone was seeing what i was seeing, but i didn't see anyone who was looking skyward. i intended to take the next exit so that i could stop the car and have a better look, but i was in the left lane and it wouldn't have been safe. the next exit was several miles ahead, i could not spot the formation in my rear view window, and i was running late, so i kept going (which i regret now). in the time since the sighting (about 2.5 years ago), i have observed many small and large aircraft, and i am convinced that it could not have been a formation of conventional or military aircraft, since the formation was so stationary in the sky, and too many of the objects were surrounded completely by other objects (which i believe would be an unsafe flight formation, especially in a populated area). i also don���t think it was a flock of birds catching the same thermal as there was no movement at all of the object's "wings", the "wings" had no body, head, or tail, and there was zero movement between objects, no rotation, nothing. and it was definitely not a reflection off my windshield. i recently saw a tv program that showed a tape of ufos over mexico, it gave me the same impression as to what i saw that day, though the mexico tape had more objects, the formation was less round, and the objects had less detail. i have a mechanical engineering b.s. and worked on space launch vehicles for more than 10 years.
Summary: Multiple triangle- or chevron-shaped metallic objects in late morning suburban sky.
